title: Cargo doc triggers rustc ICE

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-synthetic-impls
labels.description: Area: Synthetic impls, used by rustdoc to document auto traits and traits with blanket impls

labels.name: S-has-mcve
labels.description: A Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example has been found for this issue

body:
### Problem

Minimal example
```Rust
pub const N: usize = 1;

pub struct MapType<K: Supertrait<V>, V> {
    _array: K::Array,
}

pub trait Subtrait: Supertrait<[u8; N]> {}

pub trait Supertrait<V> {
    type Array: AnotherTrait<V>;
}

pub trait AnotherTrait<V> {
    const LENGTH: usize;
}

pub struct Container<S: Subtrait> {
    _x: MapType<S, [u8; N]>,
}
```

What I expected: `cargo doc` works.
What happens:
```
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Unexpected result when selecting Container<S> Obligation(predicate=Binder(ProjectionPredicate(ProjectionTy { substs: [S, [u8; 1]], item_def_id: DefId(0:12 ~ panic[490c]::Supertrait::Array) }, Term::Ty(_)), []), depth=2)', compiler/rustc_trait_selection/src/traits/auto_trait.rs:750:33
```

### Steps

`cargo doc` (check & build work)

### Possible Solution(s)

_No response_
